answers.answer: I don't know about the BP--other than try and eat low sodium.For the GD--eat low carb foods---stay away from white breads and pastas--certain fruit has very high sugars--try and stay away from canned fruit in syrup bad for you--and just because it says sugar free does not mean it is carb free.  I had GD with  my first pg.

Regarding high blood pressure, definitely reduce the amount of sodium in your diet (decrease the amount of processed also can help-it is crazy how much sodium gets added to that food) and keep drinking the water.   If it comes to the point where medication is needed, methyldopa seems to be one of the best medications, as it is a Category B pregnancy medication (versus most other BP med. in Category C).  Methyldopa is one of the oldest forms of BP medication and according to my doctor and my research, it is the only one to have an extensive study done on pregnant women (obviously studies are no longer done on pg women), which followed the babies into childhood. There were no side effects in the children.  I have high blood pressure and am currently taking the methyldopa.  Best of luck with everything!
